revised_title: Evolution of Anti-Predator Behavior in Guppies
tldr: This study investigates the behavioral consequences of introducing guppies in N. Trinidad and how it provides evidence for the evolution of anti-predator behavior in the wild. The research shows that inherited behavior patterns, such as schooling and predator inspection, are modified by selection. The findings document inter-drainage differences in behavior that cannot be attributed to variation in the predation regime.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Behavioral Ecology
